lines.text: You didn't let me finish. I was going to say 'turn right here left'.
Turn right here left? Have you any conception how much room it takes to turn this thing around? We may have to go on for miles.
It's a fine thing when you come home to your home and your home is gone!
Get that check back. I was going to get us a deepfreeze.

[gesturing to the in-laws staring coldly at them]
You're getting a deepfreeze right now.
What happened?
Oh nothing, I just cracked my skull.
[repeated line]
Trailer brakes first!
This is Mrs. Dudley, the big vagabond next door.
How do you do, Mrs. Vagabond?
Think of it as a train behind you. Forty feet of train.
Been married long?
About 31 years.
Have many fights?
Nope.
don't buy a trailer.
What good is a trailerite if not to help out another trailerite?
me or the money.
You tore down my roses with your lousy, stinking trailer!
[starts crying]

[as they are packing up the trailer for the honeymoon]
Honey, I told you to put your clothes in the hall closet!

[in a heavy accent]
Well, the hall closet is full of your things.
[sounds like "thins"]
Oh. Oh, well, put your thins there temporarily. Now come on.
Were the trailer repairs expensive?
No more than a room at the Ritz.
